00010 // Check against redundant including
00011 #ifndef TT_PHASOR_H
00012 #define TT_PHASOR_H
00013 
00014 // Include appropriate headers
00015 #include "tt_audio_base.h"
00016 
00017 
00018 /********************************************************
00019         CLASS INTERFACE/IMPLEMENTATION
00020 
00021         The entire class is implemented inline for speed.
00022  ********************************************************/
00023 
00024 class tt_phasor:public tt_audio_base{
00025 
00026         private:
00027                 tt_attribute_value              frequency;                      // define the ramp time cycle in hertz
00028                 tt_attribute_value              ramp_ms;                        // ramp time in milliseconds
00029                 long                                    ramp_samps;                     // ramp time in samples
00030                 tt_attribute_value              gain;
00031 
00032                 tt_sample_value                 current;                        // 
00033                 double                                  step;                           //              
00034         
00035         public:
00036                 enum selectors{                                                         // Attribute Selectors
00037                         k_ramp_ms,
00038                         k_ramp_samps,
00039                         k_frequency,
00040                         k_phase,
00041                         k_gain,
00042                         k_gain_direct,
00043                 };
00044                 
00045 
00046                 // OBJECT LIFE                                  
00047                 tt_phasor()                                                                     // Constructor          
00048                 {
00049                         current = 0;
00050                         step = 0;
00051                         gain = 1.0;
00052                 }
00053 
00054                 ~tt_phasor()                                                            // Destructor
00055                 {
00056                         ;
00057                 }
00058 
00059 
00060                 // OVER-RIDE THE INHERITED SET SR METHOD
00061                 void set_sr(int value)
00062                 {
00063                         if(value != sr){
00064                                 sr = value;                                     // These first three need to be called to do the standard stuff from the base class
00065                                 r_sr = 1.0 / value;                     //      THERE SHOULD BE A MORE ELEGANT WAY OF DOING THIS, NO ?!?!?!?!?
00066                                 m_sr = (float)sr * 0.001;       //              ...
00067                         
00068                                 // This is the SR setting stuff that is specific to this object.
00069                                 set_attr(k_frequency, frequency);               // set our step size (etc)
00070                         }
00071                 }
00072 
00073 
00074                 // ATTRIBUTES
00075                 void set_attr(tt_selector sel, tt_attribute_value val)  // Set Attributes
00076                 {
00077                         switch (sel){
00078                                 case k_phase:
00079                                         current = val;
00080                                         break;
00081                                 case k_frequency:
00082                                         frequency = val;
00083                                         if(frequency == 0){
00084                                                 ramp_samps = 1;
00085                                                 ramp_ms = 0;
00086                                         }
00087                                         else{
00088                                                 ramp_samps = long((1.0 / frequency) * sr);
00089                                                 ramp_ms = 1000.0 * (ramp_samps / float(sr));
00090                                         }
00091                                         break;
00092                                 case k_ramp_ms:
00093                                         ramp_ms = val;
00094                                         ramp_samps = long((ramp_ms * 0.001) * sr);
00095                                         frequency = 1 / (ramp_samps / float(sr));
00096                                         break;
00097                                 case k_ramp_samps:
00098                                         ramp_samps = long(val);
00099                                         ramp_ms = 1000.0 * (ramp_samps / float(sr));
00100                                         frequency = 1 / (ramp_samps / float(sr));
00101                                         break;
00102                                 case k_gain:
00103                                         gain = decibels_to_amplitude(val);
00104                                         break;
00105                                 case k_gain_direct:
00106                                         gain = val;
00107                         }
00108                         step = 1.0 / double(ramp_samps);        // 1.0 is the destination
00109                 }
00110 
00111                 tt_attribute_value get_attr(tt_selector sel)                            // Get Attributes
00112                 {
00113                         switch (sel){
00114                                 case k_phase:
00115                                         return current;
00116                                 case k_frequency:
00117                                         return frequency;
00118                                 case k_ramp_ms:
00119                                         return ramp_ms;
00120                                 case k_ramp_samps:
00121                                         return tt_attribute_value(ramp_samps);
00122                                 case k_gain:
00123                                         return amplitude_to_decibels(gain);
00124                                 case k_gain_direct:
00125                                         return gain;
00126                                 default:
00127                                         return 0.0;
00128                         }
00129                 }
00130                 
00131                 
00132                 // DSP LOOP
00133                 void dsp_vector_calc(tt_audio_signal *out)
00134                 {
00135                         temp_vs = out->vectorsize;
00136                         while(temp_vs--){
00137                                 current += step;
00138                                 if(current >= 1.0)
00139                                         current -= 1.0;
00140                                 else if(current < 0.0)
00141                                         current += 1.0;
00142                                 *out->vector++ = current * gain;        
00143                         }
00144                         out->reset();
00145                 }
00146 };
00147 
00148 
00149 #endif  // TT_PHASOR_H
